author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Decline as Investors Reassess Italy Concerns
text:
U.S. government bond prices fell Wednesday, retracing some of the gains from Tuesdayâ€™s rally as investors reassessed the political turmoil in Italy.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.842% from 2.772% Tuesday, snapping four straight days of declines. The two-year Treasury note yield also climbed to 2.411% from 2.319% after falling the most in one day since March 2009. Yields rise as bond prices fall.
Yields...
